name: Residence Inn Detroit Troy/Madison Heights

reviews.text: I recently had the pleasure of spending one night at this location and almost wished that I could stay longer. LaToya at the front desk was amazing to work with. The room was clean (a little dated) and very comfortable. The "snack" at night was a meal that was simple, but tasty and the breakfast was great. The morning staff were very helpful and eager to make our experience pleasant. Will definately stay here again when in the area.
reviews.title: "Home away from home"

reviews.text: We (four sisters) stayed at this hotel and could not have been more pleased! We had originally made the reservation for three and found that we needed to add the 4th person when one sister was released from the hospital earlier than anticipated. LaToya at the front desk worked with us to come up wih the best location and arrangements to meet our needs. The rooms were clean and wonderfully appointed. Both the evening "snack" (which is really a light meal) and the mornng breakfast were delightful. At breakfast we were met by a server eager to personally prepare belgium waffles, to add to the many other items already available.
reviews.title: Wonderful Experience!

reviews.text: The hotel is conveniently located to Beaumont Hospital; if we need to return to that area, our first booking will be a this hoel.
reviews.title: Outstanding Customer Service

reviews.text: I booked a room for a one night stay based on TripAdvisor's #1 ranking. I agree with many of the former reviews regarding the hotel itself...the outside is a bit dated but kept in good condition, but inside the rooms were very clean, large and comfortable. What makes this place is the service. I was greeted by LaToya, who was all smiles, super pleasant, and extremely accommodating. The second time I went to the desk, a woman whom I assumed to be the manager (I'm sorry, I didn't catch her name) was also extremely friendly, helpful and welcoming. Upon checkout, a third woman was equally as pleasant. The awesome staff really does make this place. Not sure it this was mentioned in previous reviews, but they serve a light dinner (pizza and salad during my stay) and an awesome breakfast, free of charge. Definitely recommend:)
reviews.title: Better than I ever could have imagined!
Quiet, clean, well-run
reviews.text: I could not wait to write a review for our stay at Residence Inn (Madison Heights). I stayed there for just over 2 months due to renovations being done on my home. From the start, I was nothing but impressed! The entire staff is warm, friendly, courteous, extremely competent and just spectacular! Anything we ever needed was addressed promptly and courteously. I can not say enough good things about this property and the staff. It runs like a well oiled machine! I have stayed at 5 star resorts that the staff didn't remotely compare to this staff. I wish I could remember all the names, but the stand outs are Susie, Latoya (and all the others), Eve and all the maintenance and housekeeping staff (but can't remember names, so sorry!). It is also a wonderful location! You have Costco just down the street and Meijer's grocery store down 13 Mile Rd. many restaurants and Oakland Mall. If you have to be away from your home for any reason or traveling to this area, THIS is your place to stay!

I had not stayed a a Residence Inn for about 5 years so wasn't sure what to expect. All in all I thought that the hotel was okay. The room was nice but I did not care for the layout. I would have preferred a room on the second floor but there are no elevators. All entrances to rooms are on the outside. I could hear footsteps from above nothing terrible but still a bit annoying.
reviews.title: Pleasant staff

reviews.text: The front desk staff and breakfast hostess were both very pleasant.
reviews.title: Detroit Business

reviews.text: I stay here whenever I am in the area, it is the only place I stay. The rooms are very clean and spacious. The staff are like family. It is my opinion that the staff here are the best in the industry.
reviews.title: Great hotel - short or long term. EXCEPTIONAL staff, very personable.
Fantastic hotel, amazing rooms!
reviews.text: Believe me I am on the road 200 days a year.

I have been a guest - almost full-time since February 2010 - at this Residence Inn property in Madison Heights, MI. I need to exspress my overwhelming satisfaction with the property management and all the staff - they are EXCEPTIONAL. They have handled a variety of special requets, handled problems with professionalism and expediency, and simple provided consistenlty superior customer service. I have stayed at Marriott properties all over the country, and the personal service this staff provide is simply exceptional - all the time. Always friendly, and willing to do whatever it takes to provide top level service.
reviews.title: Don't judge a book by it's cover

reviews.text: My family and I stayed at three different rooms in three hotels in Detroit in July and August. First we stayed one night at Embassy suites close to Detroit Metro airport, then Residence Inn by Marriott Troy in Madison Heights and finally Fairfield Inn and Suites in Farmington Hills
reviews.title: Three hotels in Detroit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Something that was unknown to me before travelling to Detroit was that there are perhaps tens of districts and small cities in Detroit. Trip advisor does not help for those of us Europeans who do not know this and search for hotels in “Detroit” only. There are also many hotels from the same chain in each county making it all very confusing.
reviews.title: Convenient

reviews.text: We stayed for one night at Embassy suites before renting a car and going to Toronto. My info from Embassy suites is therefore very limited. The hotel was old and at 4 am suddenly the fire alarm went off. No explanations to the reason and you can guess how we felt travelling from Sweden. The hotel pool is both indoor and connected to outdoor. The water in the pool was cold and not cleaned. Breakfast was good and with multiple choices. You can have your omelet made for you. Rooms were old. I loved the small garden as it was the first time in my life I saw a humming bird close to me. Our room faced ventilations and was really noisy. This hotel has free shuttles to the airport. The shuttles for all hotels are close and call the hotel after you passed through all controls because it juts takes the driver 10 minutes to come to the airport.
reviews.title: Not worth the price

reviews.text: After coming back from Toronto we stayed at Residence Inn for 13 nights. We had booked this hotel via Hotels.com for three weeks and though we booked with possibility of cancellation we misunderstood that we can even shorten our visit. This was due to problem with hotels.com info. This hotel is old and in desperate need of renovation. The breakfast is ok but the breakfast lady during weekdays makes very watery waffle batter and stops you from using the machine. The housekeeping is the worse I have seen in US. Despite the house manager whose name I have forgotten promised to check our two rooms, they were not cleaned by any standards. Everyday shampoos or something was missing and we had to go and ask for it. The pool is outside and cold and in contrast to the other two hotels there is no Jacuzzi. There is however a gas grill and basket field. No gyms. The price for laundry is higher than Fairfield Inn. The TVs are not working. Nine of the channels were having problems. Having a small kid made all the difference and therefore we moved. We talked several times to the manager and he could not fix it. At the end we asked for discount and he discounted one night which we thought was two low, basically meaning 3% for the two rooms we had rented. We therefore moved to Fairfield where the hotel was better and 30 dollars per night cheaper! This hotel is the only one with kitchen.
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.text: We checked several other hotels. One was Fairfield Inn which was much closer to where we wanted to go. Sylvia at the reception was extremely friendly and helpful. The water temperature in the pool was very pleasant, the type you just can get into without needing to warm up. There is jacuzzi and good breakfast with few more choices though not like Embassy suites. No free dinner on some nights like Residence Inn. Clean and quite rooms. This hotel is not available on hotels.com. Enough breakfast place unlike Residence Inn.
reviews.title: Nice rooms but no smoking

reviews.text: We arrived 28 Dec and was met by a wonderful Clerk. Easy cheque in and gave us a ground floor. We stayed 3 nights and enjoyed a nice different dinner and full breakfast each morning. Helped as the location was close to the Hospital I had to use. Really couldn't ask for better service, cleaner room or friendlier staff. We had to leave on the 31 to drive home; but will return for another 3 days on the 1st. Highly recommend this Residence inn. It is also close for some good shopping and nice restaurants. Over all rating is Excellent.
reviews.title: Business Trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The front desk staff is very friendly, the rooms are clean and bright and the beds are very comfortable. The kitchen had newer stainless steel appliances. New flat screen TV. The bathroom was a little out of date, but clean.
reviews.title: Nice rooms with kitchens.

reviews.text: Everyone made this a nice trip especially Sharon in the breakfast room. She always had an enjoyable story. She greeted everyone with a smile and asked what she could help them get for their breakfast. Tables are cleaned promptly and food was always full. She was sunshine.
reviews.title: Enjoyable Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently had the pleasure of staying at this property for a quick get away! We were in town for a concert at the Royal Oak Music Theatre. This location was very close, about a 10 minute cab ride. Front desk staff were very helpful in making arrangements. We stayed in a studio room that was very comfortable. Rooms were very clean! Full kitchen was a nice touch. We really enjoyed the breakfast that was included in our room rate. Lots of great choices! We would not hesitate to book this hotel again. Overall great experience!
reviews.title: Good Location!

reviews.text: I have spend a few months at this Residence Inn for business reasons, and I can stay the difference is the staff, and that make all the difference ! And it is very clear that It is a standard that is set by the General Manager, that all the staff are pleased to maintain.
reviews.title: A really good home away from home

aka: Residence Inn Detroit Troy/Madison Heights Hotel Madison Heights
description: Whether staying a day, a week, a month or more, you will have room to relax, room to work and room to breathe at the Residence Inn by Marriott – Troy/Madison Heights. Each suite includes a fully equipped kitchen and a spacious living room. Our suites offer 50% more space than an ordinary hotel room. Come stay with us and see for yourself that the Residence Inn by Marriott is your home away from home
